definition: system of constitutional government/(used as an attributive) constitutional
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: The constitutional guarantees for an independent Judiciary have been fully implemented.
sentences.chinese: 憲制上，對司法獨立的保證已全面落實。

sentences.english: Cambodia is now a constitutional monarchy where executive power is held by the prime minister.
sentences.chinese: 柬埔寨現在是一個君主立憲制國家，首相行使行政權。

sentences.english: Ministers took the floor to denounce the decision to suspend constitutional rule.
sentences.chinese: 幾位部長髮言譴責暫停憲制的決定。

sentences.english: Constitutional monarchy began after the Glorious Revolution in 1688.
sentences.chinese: 君主立憲制是從1688年的光榮革命後開始。
